sentence.idiomatic: Actually, he is very clever.
Actually, he already came a while ago.
Learning Chinese isn't actually that difficult.
He's so tired. Do you feel sorry for him?
He has lost something, but he isn't distressed at all.
He got hurt. I really feel for him.
As long as you study hard, you can learn Chinese.
You will buy it as long as it's delicious?
As long as you come I'll be happy.
I don't need to trouble you; I know where it is.
Do you have time? Could I bother you for a minute?
Could I trouble you to hold this for me for a minute?
What are her eyelashes like?
His eyelashes aren't nice-looking.
Her eyelashes are long and thick.
She bought a new tube of mascara.
She used green mascara.
When you use mascara your eyes look much bigger.
He left, but I'm not sad at all.
When I first left home it was my saddest time.
He failed again, and he's very depressed.
Lily, it’s really late. I will bring you home, OK?
You have to work tomorrow. I don’t want to trouble you.
Don’t be so polite. I don’t even know where you live. In the future how will I be able to pick you up for work?
All right. Today, once again, you ordered so many dishes that we couldn’t finish them all.
It doesn’t matter. As long as you liked them, that’s all that matters. You work so far from home, I really feel for you.
It’s not that bad. You work even harder. Plus, every day you also chat with me until so late.
Actually, that’s the happiest part of my day. Your eyelashes are so pretty.
That’s because I used mascara.
But even when you don’t wear lipstick, your lips are still so beautiful. You know, the saddest part of my day is when I leave you.
Oh, stop it.
